meanings.definition: Tending to nag or complain persistently
meanings.sent1: She became even naggier when her favorite show was interrupted.
meanings.sent2: The naggier tone in her voice made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The naggier she got, the more her friends avoided her.
meanings.sent4: Her naggier attitude was like a dark cloud hanging over the group.
meanings.sent5: The naggier she became, the less people wanted to be around her.

meanings.sent1: Today, she seemed naggier than yesterday about the chores.
meanings.sent2: The weather was naggier than usual, making everyone grumpy.
meanings.sent3: His naggier behavior was actually quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The naggier atmosphere at work was suffocating.
meanings.sent5: The naggier he acted, the more his friends teased him.
